page.title: 19The Railway At Ore
page.content: The Hastings to Ashford Railway runs through our squares.It was built about 1849/50.One of the main works on this line was the Ore tunnel which is three quarters of a mile long.It begins to the west of Frederick Road and ends at Coghurst Gateway.The deepest shaft was 204 ft deep.It has a red -brick structure on top and can still be seen off the main road just past Frederick Road in Simes Ground. The men building the railway were called "navvies" and those in charge of them were called "gangers." The gangers chose badly behaved drunken men to work on the railway line,and many accidents occurred.Also to the annoyance of the church the men were encouraged to work on Sundays.
